revised_title: The Parenchymous Parts of the Body: A Reevaluation of Their Role and Function
tldr: The author challenges the traditional understanding of parenchyma, the tissue believed to be void of vessels, by examining the structure and function of various organs. They argue that these organs are composed entirely of vessels, which play a crucial role in blood circulation and muscle physiology. This discovery has implications for understanding the function of the human body and could lead to new insights into health and disease.
